intro: Gomphocarpus padifolius, commonly known as the yellow moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that open at night. The plant has a distinctive, hairy stem and produces small, greenish fruits that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
